entry.title: Everything You Need to Know About SAP Discovery Center Before TechEd
entry.content:
SAP TechEd 2025 is approachingâ€”the premier annual event for SAP developers, solution architects, and IT professionals worldwide. With thousands of sessions, hands-on workshops, and networking opportunities waiting for you, success at TechEd depends on how well-prepared you arrive. That's where the SAP Discovery Center's latest updates come in. 

From a comprehensive SAP AI Return-On-Investment (ROI) calculator that provides real-time financial justification for AI packages to an enhanced SAP BTP Guidance Framework that serves as your star map to best practices, these updates, these updates directly address the challenges you face every day: proving value, reducing implementation risk, and accelerating digital transformation timelines.

Whether you're a solution architect planning your next SAP Business Technology Platform implementation, a developer exploring AI possibilities, or an IT leader who needs to justify technology investments with hard numbers, the new SAP Discovery Center features will become your most valuable pre-TechEd preparation. Let's dive into what's new, why it matters, and how you can leverage these tools to maximize your TechEd experience and drive immediate value back to your organization.

AI on SAP Discovery Center

1. Enhanced AI Catalogue: Your Complete AI Solution Navigator

The SAP Business AI Catalogue has received a major upgrade that transforms how you explore and evaluate AI solutions. The catalogue now features dedicated categories for "Joule" and "AI Agent", making it easier than ever to find the specific AI capabilities you need for your organization.

Major Enhancements:

  • The catalogue now reflects SAP's new per-user-per-month commercial model, providing transparent pricing visibility
  • AI packages that bundle AI agents and features alongside consumption-based AI agents and features for flexible implementation options
  • Comma-separated value (CSV) export functionality allows you to download the entire AI catalogue for offline analysis, team sharing, and integration with your procurement processes

ðŸ”—Explore the enhanced AI Catalogue: https://discovery-center.cloud.sap/ai-catalog/

 

2. Streamlined Discovery with Intelligent Filtering

The completely redesigned filters improve the experience of searching through SAP Discovery Centerâ€™s AI offerings. The updated interface and enhanced look-and-feel make finding relevant offerings faster and more efficient.

Key Improvements:

  • Smart filters help you pinpoint AI offerings that match your specific use cases, industry, and technical requirements
  • At-a-glance information on catalogue cards provides essential details without requiring deep navigation
  • Improved user experience that reduces time-to-insight and accelerates your AI exploration journey

 

3. ROI-Driven Decision Making with the AI Estimator

The new Return-on-Investment (ROI) calculation feature added to the AI Estimator transforms how organizations evaluate and justify AI investments. With the ROI estimation, users can make more informed decisions on AI packages and consumption-based AI offerings.

Game-Changing Capabilities:

  • Real-time ROI calculations for both AI packages and consumption-based AI offerings
  • Transparent methodology that explains how ROI estimates are calculated, building confidence in your investment decisions
  • Business case support that provides the financial justification needed for executive approval and budget allocation

ðŸ”—Calculate your AI ROI: https://discovery-center.cloud.sap/ai-estimator-v1

 

4. Integrated AI and SAP BTP Service Connections

The enhanced SAP BTP Service Catalogue with clear linkage between AI offerings and SAP BTP services now shows exactly which AI offerings relate to specific services, providing comprehensive visibility into how AI capabilities can amplify your existing SAP BTP investments.

Revolutionary Features:

  • Direct AI offering visibility within SAP BTP service detail pages eliminates the guesswork in finding relevant AI capabilities
  • Improved use case planning and implementation by understanding how AI can enhance your existing SAP BTP services, and with clear connections between the AI foundation and AI capabilities

ðŸ”—Explore integrated AI offerings: https://discovery-center.cloud.sap/serviceCatalog/sap-build-process-automation?region=all&tab=relatedaiofferings

Other Updates on SAP Discovery Center

1. SAP BTP Guidance Framework: Your Star Map for Guidance Assets

The new SAP BTP Guidance Framework is a resource that extends the scope for architects by providing comprehensive methodologies and guidance. This framework serves as your guide toward architecting, developing, and deploying enterprise-grade solutions on SAP BTP.

What Makes This Framework Essential:

  • Structured adoption phases provide clear direction and a proven approach for adopting SAP BTP according to industry best practices
  • Tailored recommendations drive your organization's SAP BTP maturity through an integrated maturity assessment
  • Strategic decision support helps you make the right decisions at the right time, maximizing value from your SAP BTP investments
  • Comprehensive guidance covers everything from initial planning to advanced enterprise implementations

This framework is particularly valuable for SAP TechEd attendees who want to move beyond tactical implementations to strategic, enterprise-scale SAP BTP adoption.

ðŸ”—Access the BTP Guidance Framework: https://discovery-center.cloud.sap/guidance-framework

 

2.  Events: Expanding the SAP Discovery Center Knowledge Universe

The SAP Discovery Center homepage now features a dedicated Events section. This new section serves as a centralized resource for hands-on events designed for both SAP customers and partners, adding another dimension to the Discovery Center's comprehensive learning ecosystem.

Partner and Customer Benefits:

  • Hands-on learning opportunities help customers and partners deepen their knowledge and enhance their technical skills
  • Knowledge transfer that benefits the entire ecosystem by making expertise more accessible to all audiences
  • Networking opportunities connect partners with SAP experts and fellow practitioners
  • Customer value enhancement through access to more knowledgeable, qualified partners
  • Ecosystem strengthening by making partner enablement more visible and accessible
  • Accelerated adoption through joint events that align partner capabilities with customer needs and use cases

ðŸ”—Discover events: https://discovery-center.cloud.sap/index.html#

 

3.  Latest Mission Releases: Learning That Drives Results

The SAP Discovery Center continues to expand its use case portfolio with five new missions that address the most pressing enterprise challenges:

ðŸš€Activate Joule with SAP Integrated Business Planning (IBP)
ðŸš€Setup of Joule in Mobile Start
ðŸš€Accelerate Smart Supplier Selection with Retrieval-Augmented Generative AI
ðŸš€Migrate data from SAP Business One to SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition
ðŸš€Accelerate your BTP Journey with FRE Acceleration Datasphere Pack

These hands-on experiences provide practical, implementable knowledge that bridges the gap between theoretical understanding and real-world application, ensuring both partners and customers can immediately leverage cutting-edge SAP technologies.

How Missions Guide Your Journey: 

  • Hands-on learning experiences that provide practical skills through guided, interactive tutorials and real-world scenarios
  • Self-paced exploration allows partners and customers to learn at their own speed and revisit content as needed
  • Comprehensive skill development covering beginner to advanced topics across SAP's entire technology portfolio
  • Immediate practical application with step-by-step guidance that can be implemented directly in production environments  
  • Reduced learning curve for new SAP technologies through expert-designed tutorials and best practices

ðŸ”— Explore all new missions: https://discovery-center.cloud.sap/missioncatalog

 

SAP Business Technology Platform â€“ Priority Use Cases

Explore the comprehensive range of SAP Business Technology Platform use cases that these missions support here:

ðŸ”—https://www.sap.com/products/technology-platform/use-cases.html?sort=latest_desc

 

Your Next Steps

As you prepare for SAP TechEd 2025, think of these tools as your spacecraft's vital systems: the ROI Calculator as your fuel efficiency monitor, ensuring every investment delivers maximum propulsion; the SAP BTP Guidance Framework as your star maps, guiding you safely through complex architectural decisions; and the Events as your communication array, keeping you connected with the broader SAP ecosystem of knowledge and expertise.

The countdown to SAP TechEd has begun. Your mission parameters are set. These SAP Discovery Center updates aren't just featuresâ€”they're your launch sequence for achieving breakthrough results. Whether you're embarking on your first SAP BTP expedition or you're a seasoned space traveller ready for advanced AI exploration, you now have everything needed for a successful mission.

 

Ready for liftoff to transform your SAP journey?

  • Register now and start building your agenda
  • Connect with us on social media for real-time updates
  • Join the conversation using #SAPTechEd2025

In the next blog, we will discuss our recommended sessions for your SAP TechEd agenda in more detail.

Don't just attend SAP TechEd 2025â€”make it the catalyst for your next breakthrough.

entry.title: SAP UI5 application to Export Data to spreadsheet from SAP UI5 tree table (sap.ui.table.TreeTable)
entry.content:
Introduction : 
    In this article, we are going to understand how to implement  export functionality the sap.ui.table.TreeTable table data to the excel(Spreadsheet) using  sap.ui.export.Spreadsheet library. In this application, we are going to create an SAP UI5 free style application which has sample JSON  data  that has employees and their family details for the expense share percentage of the medical insurance (taken as an example) and that has been binded to the UI table and a toggle button has been added to trigger the export or downloading the excel data.

Procedure: 
This is step by step guide to create a fiori application with SAP UI5 UI table and Export Button
Step 1: Create a Fiori Project

To begin, create a new SAP Fiori project using the  Fiori Generator Freestyle - Basic template. This will serve as the foundation for our application.

 

 

 

Application Folder Structure: 

 

 

Step 2 : Create a Dynamic Page , add UI Table Details and Add the sample JSON Data in controller 

  In TreeTableView.view.xml, Add this code and add the Sample JSON data model object in the onInit() in TreeTableView.Controller.js .

TreeTableView.view.xml

<mvc:View
    controllerName="com.example.treeexporttoexcel.controller.TreeTableView"
    xmlns:mvc="sap.ui.core.mvc"
    xmlns="sap.m"
    xmlns:table="sap.ui.table"
>
    <Page
        id="page"
        title="{i18n>title}"
    >
        <content>
            <table:TreeTable
                id="employeeTreeTable"
                selectionMode="None"
                enableColumnReordering="false"
                rows="{ 
       path : '/Employees',
       parameters :{
       arrayNames:['Employees','FamilyMembers']
       }
        }"
            >
               <table:extension>
                 <OverflowToolbar>
                        <Title text="{i18n>title}" />
                        <ToolbarSpacer />
                        <ToggleButton id="export_btn" text="{i18n>export_btn}" icon="sap-icon://excel-attachment" press="onExcelExport"/>
                    </OverflowToolbar>
               </table:extension>     
                <table:columns>
                    <table:Column>
                        <table:label>
                            <Text text="{i18n>employeeID}" />
                        </table:label>
                        <table:template>
                            <Text text="{EmployeeID}" />
                        </table:template>
                    </table:Column>
                    <table:Column>
                        <table:label>
                            <Text text="{i18n>employeeName}" />
                        </table:label>
                        <table:template>
                            <Text text="{EmployeeName}" />
                        </table:template>
                    </table:Column>
                    <table:Column>
                        <table:label>
                            <Text text="{i18n>designation}" />
                        </table:label>
                        <table:template>
                            <Text text="{Designation} " />
                        </table:template>
                    </table:Column>
                    <table:Column>
                        <table:label>
                            <Text text="{i18n>familyMemberName}" />
                        </table:label>
                        <table:template>
                            <Text text="{MemberName}" />
                        </table:template>
                    </table:Column>
                    <table:Column>
                        <table:label>
                            <Text text="{i18n>relation}" />
                        </table:label>
                        <table:template>
                            <Text text="{Relationship}" />
                        </table:template>
                    </table:Column>
                    <table:Column>
                        <table:label>
                            <Text text="{i18n>age}" />
                        </table:label>
                        <table:template>
                            <Text text="{Age}" />
                        </table:template>
                    </table:Column>
                    <table:Column>
                        <table:label>
                            <Text text="{i18n>expense}" />
                        </table:label>
                        <table:template>
                            <Text text="{ExpenseShare}" />
                        </table:template>
                    </table:Column>
                </table:columns>
            </table:TreeTable>
        </content>
    </Page>
</mvc:View>

TreeTable.controller.js

sap.ui.define([
    "sap/ui/core/mvc/Controller",
    "sap/ui/model/json/JSONModel",
    "sap/m/MessageToast",
    "sap/ui/export/Spreadsheet"
], (Controller, JSONModel, MessageToast, Spreadsheet) => {
    "use strict";

    return Controller.extend("com.example.treeexporttoexcel.controller.TreeTableView", {
        onInit() {
            var oView = this.getOwnerComponent();
            var oDataModel = new JSONModel();
            var aData = {
                "Employees": [
                    {
                        "EmployeeID": "E001",
                        "EmployeeName": "Ramesh",
                        "Designation": "Manager",
                        "FamilyMembers": [
                            {
                                "MemberName": "Anitha",
                                "Age": 35,
                                "Relationship": "Wife",
                                "ExpenseShare": 40
                            },
                            {
                                "MemberName": "Rohith",
                                "Age": 10,
                                "Relationship": "Son",
                                "ExpenseShare": 20
                            },
                            {
                                "MemberName": "Ramanaiah",
                                "Age": 65,
                                "Relationship": "Father",
                                "ExpenseShare": 20
                            },
                            {
                                "MemberName": "Kamala",
                                "Age": 60,
                                "Relationship": "Mother",
                                "ExpenseShare": 20
                            }
                        ]
                    },
                    {
                        "EmployeeID": "E002",
                        "EmployeeName": "Sumana",
                        "Designation": "Developer",
                        "FamilyMembers": [
                            {
                                "MemberName": "Bhargav",
                                "Age": 35,
                                "Relationship": "Husband",
                                "ExpenseShare": 20
                            },
                            {
                                "MemberName": "Prasanna",
                                "Age": 9,
                                "Relationship": "Daughter",
                                "ExpenseShare": 20
                            },
                            {
                                "MemberName": "Ananda",
                                "Age": 58,
                                "Relationship": "Father",
                                "ExpenseShare": 40
                            },
                            {
                                "MemberName": "Srinidhi",
                                "Age": 55,
                                "Relationship": "Mother",
                                "ExpenseShare": 20
                            }
                        ]
                    },
                    {
                        "EmployeeID": "E003",
                        "EmployeeName": "Manish",
                        "Designation": "Auditor",
                        "FamilyMembers": [
                            {
                                "MemberName": "Bhumesh",
                                "Age": 58,
                                "Relationship": "Father",
                                "ExpenseShare": 60
                            },
                            {
                                "MemberName": "Rajeswari",
                                "Age": 50,
                                "Relationship": "Mother",
                                "ExpenseShare": 40
                            }
                        ]
                    }

                ]
            }

            oDataModel.setData(aData);
            oView.setModel(oDataModel);
        },
}); 
});

Step 3 : Implement the press event trigger of the Export To excel Button
   Add this logic in controller.js . "sap/ui/export/Spreadsheet" is the library should be used for excel export.
_convertTreeForExport() is a recursive function to fetch the child records converts to flat structure and pushes to the export data where this export data is passed to the settings of the excel sheet data.
TableView.controller.js

 onExcelExport() {
            var oBundle = this.getOwnerComponent().getModel("i18n").getResourceBundle();
            var oTable = this.byId("employeeTreeTable");
            var oBinding = oTable.getBinding("rows");
            var aData = oBinding.getModel().getProperty("/Employees");
            var aExportData = this._convertTreeForExport(aData);
            var aCols = [
                {
                    label : oBundle.getText("employeeID"),
                    property :"EmployeeID"
                },
                {
                     label : oBundle.getText("employeeName"),
                    property :"EmployeeName"

                },
                {
                      label : oBundle.getText("designation"),
                    property :"Designation"
                },
                {
                       label :oBundle.getText("familyMemberName"),
                    property :"MemberName"

                },
                {

                       label : oBundle.getText("relation"),
                    property :"Relationship"
                },
                  {

                       label : oBundle.getText("age"),
                    property :"Age"
                }, {

                       label :  oBundle.getText("expense"),
                    property :"ExpenseShare"
                }
            ]
            var oSettings = {
                workbook: {
                    columns: aCols,
                    context: {
                        sheetName: oBundle.getText("sheetName")
                    }
                },
                dataSource: aExportData,
                fileName: oBundle.getText("fileName"),
                worker: false
            };
            var oSpreadsheet = new Spreadsheet(oSettings);
            oSpreadsheet.build().then(function () {
                MessageToast.show(oBundle.getText("successMessage"));
            }).finally(function () {
                oSpreadsheet.destroy();
            })
        },
          
        _convertTreeForExport(aNodes, iLevel =0, aResult =[]){
// aNodes will have the tree table  data 
// iLevel -> current hierarchy depth initializes with 0
// aResult -> collector array of the flattened data 
            aNodes.forEach(oNode => {
                // taking shallow copy of each node to perform manipulations on the copy node without  // disturbing the actual data node
                   var oCopy = { ...oNode };
// deleting FamilyMembers nested structure to avoid recursion loops if not deleted it will throw  // the maximum call stack exceeded error
                delete oCopy.FamilyMembers;
                oCopy.level = iLevel + 1;
// creates a new field for visualize indentation  parent, child, grandchild etc., 
                oCopy.IndentedName = `${"".repeat(iLevel*4)}${oNode.name}`
                aResult.push(oCopy);
                if(oNode.FamilyMembers && oNode.FamilyMembers.length > 0){
                    this._convertTreeForExport(oNode.FamilyMembers, iLevel + 1, aResult);
                }
            });
               return aResult
        }

Application Screen:

 

 

ExportData.xlsx

 

 

Git Link for reference
https://github.com/RangarajasreeSV/tree-table-export-to-excel-ui5

Conclusion: 
By following these steps, We can achieve the export functionality of the The SAP UI tree table data to the Excel spreadsheet.


Thanks and Regards,
Sree Vedavyasa Rangarajasree

entry.title: Customers and Partners Innovate Without Limits on SAP BTP with SAP Integration Suite and SAP Build
entry.content:
Across industries and around the world, organizations are discovering new possibilities with SAP Business Technology Platform (SAP BTP). By connecting their business ecosystem, building apps, and automating processes with intelligence, theyâ€™re driving faster innovation and growth.

With SAP Integration Suite and SAP Build, companies can easily connect systems, create applications quickly, and automate processes with AI, unlocking value and agility like never before.

Here are some of the ways customers and partners are driving transformation with SAP BTP.

Olam Agri: Unlocking Cash Flow and Real-Time Insights

  • Global agri-business Olam Agri (S$33.2 billion in annual revenue) transformed its finance operations with SAP BTP.
  • In just nine months, Olam Agri migrated from ECC to RISE with SAP on AWS, covering 35 countries and 90 entities.
  • Using SAP Integration Suite, the company established real-time bank connectivity and freed S$250 million in treasury cash.
  • With SAP Build, Olam Agri created cost-tracking apps that deliver near-real-time visibility across its global operations.

ðŸ“½ï¸ Watch the Olam Agri Story to see how connected finance drives results.

Mindsprint: Scaling Digital Transformation Worldwide

  • Operating in more than 60 countries, Mindsprint helps customers accelerate their RISE with SAP and GROW with SAP journeys.
  • Using SAP Integration Suite, Mindsprint connects SAP and non-SAP systems while maintaining a clean ERP core. With SAP Build, Mindsprint develops scalable custom extensions and AI-driven process intelligence to help customers optimize their business performance.

ðŸ“½ï¸ Watch the Mindsprint Partner Story to learn how innovation scales globally.

Visa: Embedding Payments Seamlessly into ERP

  • Visa Commercial Solutions, in collaboration with ABeam Consulting, is simplifying B2B payments through embedded finance.
  • With SAP Integration Suite, Visa connected its global payment network directly to SAP systems, enabling automated reconciliation and direct invoice payments.
  • Using SAP Build, the team delivered a smooth in-app payment experience from concept to go-live in just six months.

ðŸ“½ï¸ Watch the Visa Story to see how embedded finance accelerates business.

ABeam Consulting: Driving Intelligent Enterprise Innovation

  • With more than 9,000 consultants across Asia, ABeam Consulting delivers end-to-end SAP transformations across SAP ERP Cloud, SuccessFactors, Ariba, and Concur.
  • Leveraging SAP BTP with SAP Integration Suite and SAP Build, ABeam helps customers integrate complex system landscapes while extending business processes with rapid application development that leverages AI and Joule-powered automation.

ðŸ“½ï¸ Watch the ABeam Partner Story to see how automation and AI are redefining enterprise innovation.

Mamee: Building Agility and Modernizing Operations

  • Snacking leader Mamee partnered with cbs Consulting to strengthen its operations and build a more agile business foundation.
  • Implemented RISE with SAP, SAP Integration Suite, and SAP Build.
  • Reduced integration errors by 70%.
  • Achieved 100% improvement in cash-flow monitoring and 50% faster approvals.
  • With a modern, connected digital core, Mamee is fueling growth with greater efficiency and transparency.

ðŸ“½ï¸ Watch the Mamee Story to see how digital agility drives performance.

cbs Consulting: Partnering for Continuous Innovation

  • With more than 30 years of SAP partnership, cbs Consulting helps organizations move confidently to the cloud and innovate on SAP BTP.
  • cbs Consulting develops smart extensions, automates processes, and connects SAP and non-SAP systems with SAP Build and SAP Integration Suite. Its accelerators help customers reduce technical debt and streamline migrations to SAP S/4HANA.
  • Through close collaboration with SAP, cbs is embedding AI and machine learning into customer solutions.

ðŸ“½ï¸ Watch the cbs Partner Story to learn about their innovative approach.

Now It's Your Turn to Innovate Without Limits

I hope these stories inspire you to start your innovation journey with SAP BTP. Explore how SAP partners can help you with their deep experience, skills, and domain expertise with SAP Integration Suite and SAP Build solutions. 

Register now for complimentary partner discovery webinars or workshops to see how they can help you. 

  • SAP Integration Suite Partner Webinars  
  • SAP Build Partner Discovery Workshops

If youâ€™re an SAP partner, access a wealth of exclusive resources on SAP PartnerEdge to further accelerate your growth and success with SAP BTP.

entry.title: Frontend Strategies for SAP Sales Cloud V2: An Architectâ€™s Perspective on Modern UI Extensions
entry.content:
Introduction

As an SAP architect, Iâ€™m sharing my perspective on choosing the right frontend technologies and design strategies for SAP Sales Cloud V2. Selecting the appropriate frontend is not just about framework preferenceâ€”it impacts user experience, integration, maintainability, performance, scalability, and adherence to SAPâ€™s design principles.

While SAP Fiori provides a standardized and proven design framework, Sales Cloud V2 introduces a modern, non-Fiori-based UI. In this article, Iâ€™ll provide guidance on balancing Fiori compliance, lightweight frontend frameworks like React, seamless backend integration, performance, and scalability, along with best practices for extensions, mashups, and side-by-side scenarios with S/4HANA.

Understanding SAP Sales Cloud V2's UI

SAP Sales Cloud V2 introduces a modern, intuitive UI designed to enhance user experience and productivity. Unlike traditional SAP Fiori applications, V2's UI is not strictly Fiori-based. It leverages contemporary design principles to provide a seamless and engaging user interface.

For a visual overview of SAP Sales Cloud V2 UI.

 

Frontend Development Considerations

1. Aligning with SAP Fiori Design Principles

SAP Fiori offers a set of design principles aimed at creating consistent and user-friendly interfaces. While V2's UI is not Fiori-based, developers can still adhere to Fiori's design guidelines to ensure a cohesive user experience. Key considerations include:

  • Consistency: Maintaining uniform design elements across applications.
  • Efficiency: Optimizing workflows to reduce user effort.
  • Intuitiveness: Designing interfaces that are easy to understand and navigate.
  • Performance: Ensuring fast rendering and responsiveness.
  • Scalability: Designing the frontend to handle growing user loads and data volumes efficiently.

2. Choosing the Right Frontend Technology

The choice of frontend technology should align with the application's requirements and the desired user experience. Consider:

  • Fiori Elements (CAP / UI5): Ideal for OData-based applications requiring standardized Fiori UI patterns. Leveraging SAP BTP CAP best practices, Fiori Elements provide:
    • Metadata-driven UI generation (List Report, Object Page, Analytical List Page)
    • Out-of-the-box CRUD operations
    • Automatic audit log and change history of business object tracking.In CAP, with simple annotations and minimal effort, audit logging tracks user and system actions for compliance, while change history tracking records the actual data changes in business objects â€” capturing before and after field values for complete business transparency.
    • Attachment management support
    • Event-driven integration through SAP Event Mesh
    • Extensibility for custom fields and actions
    • Built-in navigation, filtering, and sorting features
    • Validations and field-level rules defined in CDS models are automatically enforced, ensuring consistent data integrity across UI and backend.
    • Support for multitenancy, authentication, and authorization using SAP BTP XSUAA.
    • Integration with OData v4, REST, and messaging-based endpoints.
    • Note: If Fiori Elements annotations do not fully meet business requirements, teams should agree with business stakeholders to address those scenarios using custom UI extensions. This is not a limitation of CAP or Fiori Elements but reflects a custom requirement beyond the frameworkâ€™s standardized scope.
  • UI5 Web Components for React: Use Fiori-compliant components within a React app to combine flexibility with consistency.
    Documentation
  • React with Custom Components: For applications requiring highly customized UI aligned with Sales Cloud V2 look & feel.
  • UI5 Freestyle (SAPUI5): For deep integration with SAP backend and traditional Fiori look & feel.

When to Choose Fiori Elements for Sales Cloud V2

  • Backend services are OData-based
  • Standard UI patterns like List Report, Object Page, or Analytical List Page meet requirements
  • Minimal custom UI is needed
  • Out-of-the-box features (CRUD, attachments, audit/change history) are beneficial
  • Strict adherence to Fiori design guidelines is required
  • Faster delivery and lower TCO is a priority
  • Extensibility for custom fields and actions is needed

Balancing Look & Feel vs Out-of-the-Box Fiori

When integrating with backend services, consider:

  • Use Fiori Elements: When OData backend, standard UI patterns suffice, and business prioritizes rapid delivery, TCO, and built-in CAP features.
  • Use Custom / Lightweight Frontend: When business requires UI to match Sales Cloud V2 look & feel, heavy customization, or mashups.
  • Hybrid Approach: Combine CAP Fiori Elements for standard functionality with custom/lightweight frontends for specialized UI requirements.

Backend Integration Considerations

  • OData Services: Standard SAP protocol for frontend-backend communication
  • GraphQL: Flexible alternative to OData
  • REST APIs: For external service integration

Choose the backend service type that aligns with your frontend framework to ensure seamless integration, optimal performance, and scalability.

Extensions, Mashups, and SAP Build Apps

SAP Sales Cloud V2 supports extensions and mashups to enhance functionality:

  • Sales Cloud Extensions: Built on SAP BTP to extend V2 capabilities
  • Mashups: Embed external apps or services into Sales Cloud interface

Mashup-Based HTML UI

  • Work List: Mashup as work center feature
  • Detail View: Display detailed info in context
  • Quick View: Summarized data for fast access

Extensibility Using SAP Build Apps

SAP Build Apps enables no-code/low-code apps for all form factors. Extensions can be embedded in Sales Cloud V2.

  • Included for tenants with 100+ users
  • Additional licensing required for fewer than 100 users

References for Mashups and SAP Build Apps

  • SAP Sales Cloud Version 2 Solution Guide (PDF)
  • SAP Build Apps Setup Guide for Sales Cloud V2
  • Design and Develop Extensions using SAP AppGyver

Recommendations

  • Use Fiori Elements (CAP/UI5) for OData-based apps with standard UI patterns and built-in features (CRUD, attachments, audit)
  • Use React / custom frontend to match Sales Cloud V2 look & feel when business requires visual consistency or heavy customization
  • Use UI5 Freestyle for deep SAP backend integration and traditional Fiori UX
  • Consider hybrid approaches combining Fiori Elements and custom/lightweight frontends
  • Extensions and mashups should prioritize performance, consistency, security
  • Side-by-side scenarios with S/4HANA: maintain SAP UI5 for OData backend integration
  • Backend service type (OData, REST, GraphQL) influences frontend choice and integration approach

References

  • SAP Sales Cloud Version 2 Overview
  • UI5 Web Components for React Documentation
  • Comparison Between SAPUI5 and Web Components
  • SAP Sales Cloud V2 Features and Roadmap
  • SAP Sales Cloud V2 with S/4HANA in Action
  • SAP Sales Cloud V2 Solution Guide (PDF)
  • SAP Build Apps Setup Guide for Sales Cloud V2
  • Design and Develop Extensions using SAP AppGyver

Key Takeaways

  • Choosing the frontend technology for SAP Sales Cloud V2 requires balancing look & feel, performance, scalability, and integration capabilities.
  • For Fiori-compliant UI, Fiori Elements (CAP/UI5) or UI5 Freestyle are preferred for OData-based apps.
  • For customized, lightweight UI aligned with Sales Cloud V2, use React or other modern frameworks.
  • CAP Fiori Elements provide out-of-the-box advantages: CRUD, attachments, audit/change history, navigation, filtering, and extensibility.
  • Hybrid approaches can combine standard Fiori Elements with custom frontends for specialized UX needs.
  • Backend service type (OData, REST, GraphQL) influences frontend technology choice.
  • Extensions and mashups should prioritize consistency, performance, and security.
  • Side-by-side scenarios (Sales Cloud V2 & S/4HANA) benefit from using SAP UI5 technologies for OData backend integration.

entry.title: Activate Joule Studio in 5 Simple Steps
entry.content:
Joule Studio is a capability in SAP Build that allows organizations to create and deploy custom Joule agents and skills that automate workflows and improve efficiency across SAP and non-SAP systems. Currently the Agent Builder offering is in Beta and the Skill Builder  offering is generally available. In this blog, we will focus on activation of the Skill Builder in Joule which is now Generally Available.

Stay updated on the latest Business AI services and activation guides by following the SAP Business AI Onboarding Resource Center

The key pre-requisites to activate Skill Builder with Joule Studio are as follows:-
Access to BTP Global Account with the following entitlements available via Subscription, BTPEA, CPEA or PAYG model

  • SAP Build Process Automation, build-default (Application) plan
  • Joule, foundation (Application)/ standard (Application) plan
  • Active instance of SAP Cloud Identity Services for Identity Authentication and Identity Provisioning  

Read more about the service and pre-requisites in these following blogs from our product leaders and managers:

  • Joule Studio is generally available in SAP Build: Empower your business with intelligent automation
  • Build, Deploy, and Extend AI Agents with Joule Studio
  • How to Get Started with Joule Studio

Activating Joule Studio - Skill Builder in 5 Simple Steps

Here is a quick hit video capturing the steps documented below:

 

Onto the Joule. Studio- Skill Builder Activation!

Step 1 - Create a BTP Subaccount and Assign the Entitlements:

Create a subaccount in your BTP Global Account and select region where both Joule, foundation/ standard and Build Process Automation, build-default plans are available. Find the list of regions supported for Joule service at this SAP Help Portal link and Build Process Automation Service at this SAP Help Portal link.

  • Click on Create button on BTP Global Account landing page and select Subaccount option

  • Enter the relevant details including selecting the suitable region and click on Create button

Enable Cloud Foundry Environment

  • Click on Enable Cloud Foundry button on the subaccount landing page

  • Update the details in the window and click on Create button

Create Space in the Cloud Foundry Environment

  • Select the Create Space button that appears after the Cloud Foundry Environment is created

  • Select the relevant roles and click on the Create button

Add Joule and  Build Process Automation entitlements

  • Navigate to Entitlements section from subaccount landing page
  • Click on Edit button

  • Select Add Service Plans button

 

  • Search for Joule in the search bar and select the foundation (Application) plan of the Joule service 

  • Next, search for build process in the search bar and select the build-default (Application) plan from SAP Build Process Automation service
  • Click on  Add 2 Service Plans button to add the entitlements to the relevant subaccount

  • Click on Save button on the Entitlements page

Step 2- Complete Trust Configuration and Activate Build Process Automation (Subaccount):

Create a Trust Configuration to add authentication for application users in the IAS tenant on BTP

  • Navigate to Security > Trust Configuration section under your BTP subaccount
  • Click on Establish Trust button

  • Select the suitable IAS tenant and click on Next button

  • Choose the domain consistent with your BTP account and non-BTP applications and click on the Next button

  • Review and update the relevant parameters in this screen and click on Next button

  • Review the details and click on Finish button

Enable the Build Process Automation Service, build-default plan

  • Navigate to Instances and Subscriptions section under your BTP subaccount and click on Create button

  • Select the SAP Build Process Automation service and build-default plan and click on Create button

  • The service will be created as seen under Subscriptions

Step 3 - Run Joule Booster to Activate Joule Studio Capability Package (Global Account):

Activate Joule Studio Capability Package on SAP Build Process Automation

  • Navigate to your BTP Global Account and select the Boosters section
    • Search for Joule in the search bar and select the Setting Up Joule booster tile

  • Click on Start button

  • After the prerequisites are checked and required entitlements are met, click on Next button 

  • Select the Joule (das-application) plan and the subaccount where Build Process Automation service is activated and click on Next button

  • After selecting the products to be integrated on the following screen and selecting relevant system type option click on Next button. Review Integrating Joule with SAP Solutions help document for more details on pre-requisites for integration with the relevant SAP systems in your organization

  • Select the SAP Build Process Automation option from the Capability Packages dropdown, click on Next button

  • Review the Formation Name and select the correct service instance number - URL from the SAP Build Process Automation System dropdown then click on the Next button

  • Review the details on the final page of the booster and click on Finish button

  • After processing, the Success window appears, click on the Close button after reviewing status

Step 4 - Create Role Collection and Assign Users (Subaccount):

Create Role Collection and assign the role collection the relevant users

  • Navigate to the Subaccount where the Build Process Automation service is installed and navigate to the Role Collections section and click on Create button; Enter the relevant details and click on Create button

  • Select the recently created role collection line item from the list and click on Edit button

  • Select search help option in first empty line item under Roles

  • Enter the search text "das" Application Identifier dropdown, select the right option from the list and select the end_user and extensibility_developer roles from the list below. Click on Add button after selecting the roles

  • Click the Save button for the role collection we created

  • Navigate to Users option under the Security section of the subaccount and click Create button

  • Select the Identity Provider for which the trust configuration was added, add the user details and click on Create button

  • Click on the new user created in the table, navigate to Role Collections section, click on the options(...) and select Assign Role Collections option

  • Select the role collection created in the previous step from the list along with Build Process Automation roles and any other relevant roles and click on the Assign Role Collection button

  • Navigate to Instances and Subscriptions and select the SAP Build Process Automation instance

  • Click on Create after the Build Lobby loads

  • The Joule Skill option should now be available for you to create custom Joule Skills

Step 5 - Build Your First Custom Joule Skill:

Follow the Build custom Joule skills for SAP and non-SAP systems using Joule Studio mission to get started with building your custom skills on Joule Studio.

Congratulations, you are all set to start building Custom Skills with the Skill Builder on Joule Studio!

Please do leave kudos and comments as feedback to help us keep improving the quality of our content.

Additional Resources 

Architecture Overview

Joule Skill Demo Video

Smart Advisory Companion â€“ Inspiration Video

FAQ

SAP Buildä¸ŽSAP S/4HANAã€SAP SuccessFactorsç­‰æ ¸å¿ƒSAPåº”ç”¨æ·±åº¦é›†æˆï¼ŒåŒæ—¶è¿˜æä¾›é¢„æž„å»ºçš„è¿žæŽ¥å™¨å’Œé›†æˆæ¨¡æ¿ï¼Œå¸®åŠ©ä¼ä¸šæ›´å¥½åœ°æ‰©å±•çŽ°æœ‰SAPæŠ•èµ„

 

SAP Buildç”±ä»€ä¹ˆç»„æˆï¼Œå¯ä»¥ç”¨æ¥å¹²ä»€ä¹ˆï¼Ÿ

SAP Buildä¸»è¦åŒ…å«å››ä¸ªæ ¸å¿ƒç»„ä»¶ï¼Œå½¢æˆå®Œæ•´çš„å¼€å‘ç”Ÿæ€ç³»ç»Ÿï¼š

  • SAP Build Appsï¼šä½Žä»£ç åº”ç”¨å¼€å‘å¹³å°ï¼Œé€šè¿‡æ‹–æ‹½æ–¹å¼å¿«é€Ÿå¼€å‘å‰åŽç«¯å’Œæ•°æ®ç»“æž„ï¼Œæ›´æ˜¯å¯ä»¥ä¸€æ¬¡å¼€å‘ï¼Œå¤šæ¬¡éƒ¨ç½²æˆWebå’Œç§»åŠ¨åº”ç”¨ï¼Œæ— éœ€æ·±åº¦ç¼–ç¨‹çŸ¥è¯† ã€‚

entry.title: SAP MaxAttention Summit 2026: Shaping the Future of Enterprise Innovation
entry.content:
Weâ€™re thrilled to announce the SAP MaxAttention Summit 2026 in Heidelberg, Germany, taking place on March 24â€“26, 2026. This exclusive, in-person event brings together visionary leaders and technology innovators from the SAP MaxAttention community to explore the next level of enterprise evolution.

This yearâ€™s Summit will spotlight:

  • Agentic AI to provide predictive analytics and contextual recommendations unlocking new levels of efficiency and decision-making
  • SAP Business Data Cloud and SAP Business Technology Platform to empower your organization with real-time insights and scalable innovation
  • The integrated toolchain to enable faster execution by aligning enterprise-wide processes and supporting end-to-end orchestration
  • A clean core approach to ensure your system architecture and processes remain lean for faster innovation cycles and sustainable system evolution
  • Success Plans to streamline your innovation journey by offering a simplified, outcome-driven services portfolio

Expect compelling keynotes from SAP executives, immersive customer experience sessions, and deep-dive expert discussions. The Summit offers curated networking opportunitiesâ€¯and one-on-one meetings with senior SAP leadership â€“ designed to help you accelerate your business priorities.

Watch the recap video from the last Summit to get inspired and save the date to join us in Heidelberg for an unforgettable experience. Check out our event post to add the event to your calendar. 

Event location (Heidelberg Congress Center)

The Heidelberg Congress Center (HCC) embodies modernity and sophistication as an innovative event venue. Located next to Heidelbergâ€™s main station, it offers excellent transport connections and easy accessibility. Situated in the vibrant Bahnstadt district, the HCC is surrounded by a wide range of hotels â€“ including the ATLANTIC Hotel â€“ and remains just a short distance from the historic old town, with its charming accommodations and diverse restaurants.

Welcome reception (Tuesday, March 24, Restaurant & Bar 15 High, ATLANTIC Hotel)

The Restaurant & Bar 15 High rooftop bar at the ATLANTIC Hotel Heidelberg is an exceptional venue to connect with your peers and to grow your network. It provides a panoramic city view while you can enjoy a high-class atmosphere and unique dining experience.

Evening event (Wednesday, March 25, Heidelberg Castle)

Heidelberg Castle offers an unforgettable setting for an evening event. As one of Germanyâ€™s most famous landmarks, it represents the cityâ€™s rich history and cultural heritage. Perched high above Heidelberg, the castleâ€™s panoramic terrace provides stunning views over the old town and the surrounding hills. Its blend of historic grandeur and romantic charm creates an inspiring atmosphere â€“ perfect for networking, celebrating, and memorable experiences.

entry.title: Reimagining Logistics for the Cloud Era â€” Inside SAP Logistics Management
entry.content:
Many small and mid-sized companies still depend on siloed systems: an old WMS here, spreadsheets for transportation, and emails for carrier updates. The result? Disconnected visibility, inefficiency, and rising logistics cost.

SAP Logistics Management (LGM) reimagines this landscape.
Built natively on the SAP Business Technology Platform (BTP), LGM unifies warehousing, transportation, and network collaboration into a single intelligent cloud platform. It brings the power of SAP EWM, SAP TM, and SAP Business Network for Logistics (BN4L) together for the first time in a cloud-native experience.

Solution Overview â€” Unified, Scalable, and Built for the Cloud

SAP Logistics Management bridges execution gaps by bringing every logistics function into a unified flow: from goods receipt to shipment confirmation, across multiple warehouses, modes, and carriers.

Source: 4577_SAP_Logistics_Management_L2_Public

Key Design Principles

Principle Description
Cloud-nativeSaaS architecture, auto-updates, minimal IT footprint.
Unified logistics layerIntegrates warehouse, transport, and carrier collaboration.
AI-enabledEmbedded Joule AI assistant supports planning and exception handling.
Network-readyPre-integrated with SAP Business Network for Logistics.
Composable & scalableAdopt modules progressively (start small, scale fast).

Functional Scope â€” From Warehouse to Network

SAP LGM delivers four main functional pillars:

  1. Warehouse Logistics (cloud EWM capabilities)

  2. Transportation Logistics (cloud TM capabilities)

  3. Network Collaboration (integrated with BN4L)

  4. Unified Planning & Control (real-time visibility cockpit)

Each pillar comes with its own set of Fiori apps, use cases, and business value.

Warehouse Logistics â€” Cloud EWM Simplified

Warehouse Logistics in LGM handles end-to-end inbound, internal, and outbound warehouse operations. Designed for ease of adoption, it provides structured receiving, storage, and dispatch processes with mobile execution and embedded analytics â€” all running in the cloud.

Category Capabilities Business Benefit

InboundGoods receipt, putaway, inspectionReduce manual errors and waiting time.
InternalBin management, replenishmentOptimize space and movement.
OutboundPicking, packing, staging, loadingFaster fulfillment accuracy.
MobileScanning & task confirmationReal-time execution; paperless workflow.
MonitoringDashboards & alertsImprove supervisory visibility.

Warehouse Monitor App: Imagine a retailerâ€™s regional warehouse receiving 200 SKUs per day. The supervisor uses Warehouse Monitor to see that Putaway Zone B is overloaded while Zone C is idle. Within seconds, tasks are rebalanced to maintain service levels â€” no need for spreadsheets.

Key Fiori Apps in Warehouse Logistics

App Name Usage
Warehouse MonitorSupervisors track workload, resources, exceptions.
Execute Warehouse TasksOperators perform putaway/picking with handhelds.
Manage Inbound DeliveriesCreate, monitor, and post receipts for inbound deliveries.

Transportation Logistics â€” Intelligent Freight Orchestration

Transportation Logistics in LGM brings planning, tendering, execution, and freight costing into one intelligent workflow. It eliminates spreadsheet-based planning and manual RFQs by integrating real-time carrier collaboration.

Category Capabilities Business Benefit
PlanningLoad building, route optimisation & consolidationCut freight costs and carbon footprint.
TenderingPeer-to-peer / broadcast to carriersAutomate carrier selection.
ExecutionFreight order tracking & event managementAchieve end-to-end visibility.
CostingFreight cost calculation & invoice reconciliationImprove financial accuracy.
AppointmentDock scheduling & time windowsReduce waiting time and idle assets.

Manage Freight RFQs App: A chemical manufacturer planning an urgent dispatch to Delhi creates an RFQ in LGM. Three carriers receive tenders instantly via BN4L; within minutes, Carrier A accepts with best price and lead time â€” no emails or phone calls needed.

Key Fiori Apps in Transportation Logistics

App Name Usage
Manage Freight RFQsCreate/manage carrier RFQs.
Tender Freight OrdersPublish freight offers to carriers.
Track Freight OrdersView live shipment events & status.

Network Collaboration â€” Connected by Design

Network Collaboration within SAP LGM links shippers and carriers digitally via the SAP Business Network for Logistics. It replaces emails and calls with structured collaboration â€” carrier tenders, dock appointments, shipment events, and POD uploads all happen in one network workspace.

Category Capabilities Business Benefit
Carrier CollaborationTender acceptance / status updatesFaster onboarding, less manual follow-up.
Appointment SchedulingDock slot managementSmoother inbound/outbound flow.
Tracking & EventsMilestones & delay alertsPredictive visibility.
DocumentationProof of Delivery / Freight invoice sharingPaperless compliance.

Manage Carrier Collaboration App: A transport partner accepts a freight order from the shipper and uploads the signed POD once delivery is complete. The system automatically updates LGM and triggers freight invoice posting in ERP.

Key Fiori Apps in Network Collaboration

App Name Usage
Manage Carrier CollaborationDigital tender acceptance & status updates.
Schedule Dock AppointmentsDock slot coordination with carriers.
Monitor Shipment MilestonesTrack shipment events and POD status.

Unified Planning & Control â€” Visibility in One View

Narrative
The Unified Planning & Control cockpit serves as the command centre for logistics execution. It integrates data from warehousing, transportation, and network collaboration into one consolidated dashboard, allowing real-time monitoring and decision-making.

Feature Description
Unified Planning ConsoleAggregate view of all logistics plans & statuses.
Control TowerMonitors execution progress and exceptions.
KPI DashboardsVisualises service levels and throughput.
Exception HandlingGuided workflows to resolve delays and errors.

Logistics Dashboard App: A distribution manager opens the dashboard each morning to view all facilities on one screen. If a laneâ€™s OTD drops below 95 %, he drills into that carrier and sends an RFQ for replacement service â€” action taken within minutes, not days.

Key Fiori Apps in Unified Planning & Control

App Name Usage
Logistics DashboardKPI overview of logistics network.
Exception Management HubCentralised issue tracking & resolution.
Dashboard for PlanningCompare planned vs actual performance.

Integration â€” Seamless by Default

LGM connects to SAP Cloud ERP and SAP Business Network using standard APIs and content packages. Data flows bi-directionally for deliveries, goods movements, freight costs and invoices. This ensures a single source of truth across finance and operations.

Intelligence Layer â€” Joule AI for Smarter Decisions

Joule, SAPâ€™s AI copilot, is built into LGM. It understands context, answers in natural language, and automates common decisions like carrier selection or route replanning.

Source: 4577_SAP_Logistics_Management_L2_Public

A planner types, â€œWhich deliveries are at risk today?â€ Joule returns a list of orders facing delays and suggests rescheduling or alternate carriers based on historic performance. The planner approves in one click â€” no manual analysis

Business Benefits â€” Tangible Value for Growing Companies

Area Impact
SpeedGuided cloud deployment reduces implementation time by 50 %.
VisibilityUnified planning console gives end-to-end control.
EfficiencyAI and automation reduce manual coordination effort.
ScalabilityStart with one site or process, expand as needed.
Continuous InnovationQuarterly updates add new features without upgrades.

#SAP #SAPLogisticsManagement #SAPEWM #SAPTM #SAPBusinessNetwork #SupplyChain #CloudLogistics #AIinLogistics #Joule

entry.title: SAP TechEd 2025: Your Must-Attend Sessions on SAP BTP
entry.content:
It feels like I came back from SAP Connect just yesterday, but SAP TechEd is now less than two weeks away. In addition to the virtual event, SAP TechEd 2025 will be held in five different cities and offer hundreds of sessions. Hereâ€™s my guide to the must-attend sessions for AI agents, SAP Business Technology Platform architecture, Extensions, and Integration across the world, as well as Virtual.

 

Why SAP TechEd 2025 is Unmissable

The enterprise technology landscape is evolving at breakneck speed, and SAP TechEd 2025 promises to be the defining moment where cutting-edge innovation meets hands-on expertise. This is the leading event for developers and IT professionals ready to explore SAP's most transformative technologies and emerge with skills that deliver measurable impact from day one.

SAP TechEd

  • SAP TechEd Berlin (November 4-6, 2025) offers the flagship in-person experience where you'll connect directly with SAP experts, participate in hands-on workshops, and build lasting professional relationships within the global SAP community
  • SAP TechEd Virtual (November 4-6, 2025) provides the same high-quality technical content online for free for maximum accessibility, allowing you to explore the latest innovations in application development, integration, data, and AI from anywhere in the world

SAP TechEd on Tour

The SAP TechEd on Tour series delivers localized, immersive experiences tailored to regional technical communities. Each event combines the core SAP TechEd experience with region-specific insights, local expert networks, and formats optimized for different technical communities and career advancement goals.

  • ASUG Tech Connect in Louisville, KY (November 4-6) focuses on practical skills for North American practitioners
  • Mastering SAP in Sydney, Australia (November 12-14) brings together Asia-Pacific technical experts for intensive learning and networking
  • SAP TechEd on Tour Bangalore, India (November 25-26) offers hands-on workshops and certification boot camps designed for the thriving Indian developer community
  • DSAG TechXchange 2026 in Hamburg, Germany (March 19) provides specialized DevOps-focused sessions for European technical professionals

 

Must-Attend Sessions at SAP TechEd 2025

Don't miss these carefully curated sessions that will give you the deepest insights into SAP's technology roadmap and hands-on skills you can immediately apply. Here are my top recommendations for SAP TechEd Berlin, Virtual, and ASUG Tech Connect, organized by city and focus area:

SAP TechEd Berlin & Virtual

ðŸ—ï¸ Platform Strategy & Architecture

  • ST126 | Understanding our strategy for SAP BTP: The big picture: Get the executive overview of SAP's unified platform strategy directly from the Head of BTP Product Management. This is essential for understanding how all SAP technologies connect. 
    ðŸ—“ï¸ADD NOW â€“ BERLIN | ðŸ—“ï¸ADD NOW â€“ VIRTUAL

  • XP100 | Accelerate adoption of SAP Business Technology Platform with confidence: Learn practical implementation approaches using SAP's Architecture Center and Discovery Center resources. Perfect for planning your BTP adoption strategy. 
    ðŸ—“ï¸ADD NOW â€“ BERLIN | ðŸ—“ï¸ADD NOW â€“ VIRTUAL

ðŸ¤– AI & AI Agents

  • AD202 | Orchestrating enterprise automation with custom AI agents: Build custom AI agents from scratch in Joule Studio and integrate them with SAP Build Process Automation. Features real customer use cases from Uniper Energy
    ðŸ—“ï¸ADD NOW â€“ BERLIN | ðŸ—“ï¸ADD NOW â€“ VIRTUAL

  • AI102 | Boosting business efficiency with AI innovations in document processing: Discover how SAP Document AI automates structured and unstructured document processing with cutting-edge AI technologies. 
    ðŸ—“ï¸ADD NOW â€“ BERLIN | ðŸ—“ï¸ADD NOW â€“ VIRTUAL

  • IN200 | Empower your agents to be responsible: Understand AI agent governance and security through SAP Integration Suite's API Management capabilities.
    ðŸ—“ï¸ADD NOW â€“ BERLIN | ðŸ—“ï¸ADD NOW â€“ VIRTUAL

ðŸ’» Application Development & Automation

  • AD820 | Future of app dev in SAP Build: Simplifying clean core and LoB extensions: Get exclusive previews of upcoming SAP Build enhancements including Joule copilot integration and improved developer productivity tools. 
    ðŸ—“ï¸ADD NOW â€“ BERLIN | ðŸ—“ï¸ADD NOW â€“ VIRTUAL

  • AD104 | Boost your ABAP development with SAP Joule for Developers: Learn how AI is transforming ABAP development with SAP Joule, from code acceleration to custom AI scenario development.
    ðŸ—“ï¸ADD NOW â€“ BERLIN | ðŸ—“ï¸ADD NOW â€“ VIRTUAL

  • IN160 | Empower your business through enterprise automation: Get hands-on experience combining SAP Integration Suite with SAP Build and SAP Signavio solutions. Learn to create automation-based integrations powered by AI capabilities and prebuilt content to drive process innovation.
    ðŸ—“ï¸ADD NOW â€“ BERLIN

 ðŸ”— Integration

  • IN100 | Make your enterprise future ready with SAP Integration Suite: Essential for anyone migrating from SAP PI/PO to SAP Integration Suite. Covers tools, best practices, and technical challenges with real-world insights. 
    ðŸ—“ï¸ADD NOW â€“ BERLIN | ðŸ—“ï¸ADD NOW â€“ VIRTUAL

ðŸ”’ Security & Compliance

  • XP802 | Road map for security and compliance services in SAP BTP: Stay ahead of security requirements with upcoming BTP security features, identity management, and compliance enhancements. 
    ðŸ—“ï¸ADD NOW â€“ BERLIN | ðŸ—“ï¸ADD NOW â€“ VIRTUAL

 

ASUG Tech Connect - Louisville, KY

ðŸ—ï¸ Platform Strategy & Architecture

  • Introduction to SAP Business Technology Platform: Get a complete overview of SAP Business Technology Platform (BTP) to explore the full potential of the platform. ðŸ—“ï¸READ NOW

  • Hands-on Lab: Accelerate adoption of SAP Business Technology Platform with confidence: Gain hands-on experience in accelerating your adoption of SAP BTP with SAP Discovery Center, a single point of entry for BTP and Business AI knowledge assets. ðŸ—“ï¸READ NOW

ðŸ¤–AI & AI Agents

  • AI-Powered Document Automation: Accelerate SAP Processes with Confidence: We will share real-world examples of global companies using SAP Business Technology Platform (BTP) to streamline document processing, improve data accuracy, and achieve measurable results in a matter of weeks. ðŸ—“ï¸READ NOW

entry.title: Leveraging Web Client Procedures for Use of LLMs within HDLRE
entry.content:
Large Language Models (LLMs) are revolutionizing data management systems with their advanced semantic understanding and exceptional generalization capabilities. In this article we will explain how to leverage existing web client procedure support in SAP HANA Cloud, data lake Relational Engine (HDLRE) to integrate LLMs. With this feature, customers can now harness the power of LLMs for enhanced database management and analytics. 

 SAP AI Core, a service within the SAP Business Technology Platform, is designed to manage the execution and operations of AI assets in a standardized and scalable manner. While this article primarily focuses on SAP AI Core as the LLM service, please note that the feature is highly adaptable and can be integrated with any LLM service that best meets your requirements. 

 To deploy an LLM model within SAP AI Core, follow the instructions provided atâ€¯initial setup for SAP AI core serviceâ€¯to enable the service, generate a service key, and obtain an access token. Subsequently, you can deploy a language model, such as GPT-5 or Cloud Sonnet 4, and retrieve the deployment URL. Detailed instructions for this process are available atâ€¯create deployment for generative AI model in SAP AI core.â€¯ 

 In HDLRE, you can create a user-defined web client procedure to make HTTP requests to an HTTP server. This procedure will be used to invoke LLM services. For a more detailed explanation, please refer to theâ€¯documentation to create a procedure (web service).â€¯ 

 In our example, we have developed a web client procedure named AIPOST to make AI API calls. Ensure that the API version is specified according to the relevant AI API documentation. 

CREATE OR REPLACE PROCEDURE AIPOST ( 

â€¯ â€¯ data LONG VARCHAR 

) 

RESULT(c1 long varchar, c2 long varchar)â€¯ 

URL â€˜$YOUR_DEPLOYMENT_URL/chat/completions?$API_VERSION' 

TYPE 'HTTP:POST:application/json' 

HEADER 'Authorization:Bearer $YOUR_ACCESS_TOKEN' 

SET 'HTTP(VERSION=1.1)';

To call the procedure for an introduction to SAP HDLRE, use the following example: 

CALL AIPOST('{ "messages": [ { "role": "user", "content": "What is SAP HDLRE" } ] }');

 Building on this, more advanced and practical stored procedures can be developed to leverage LLMs effectively. For instance, if we have an expense table, with some potentially suspicious round numbers( for testing), â€¯â€¯we can employ AI to detect any irregular data patterns that may indicate potential fraud. In this procedure, we will gather all data from the expense table and submit it, along with a query, to the LLM service. 

Please be advised that the stored procedure sp_parse_json will be available in HDLRE version QRC4/2025. 

CREATE OR REPLACE PROCEDURE ask_ai_fraud_detection( 

â€¯ â€¯ IN user_question LONG VARCHAR 

) 

BEGIN 

â€¯ â€¯ DECLARE _payload LONG VARCHAR; 

â€¯ â€¯ DECLARE @expense_data LONG VARCHAR DEFAULT ''; 

â€¯ â€¯ DECLARE _response LONG VARCHAR; 

â€¯ â€¯ DECLARE @clean_question LONG VARCHAR; 

â€¯ â€¯â€¯ 

â€¯ â€¯ IF user_question LIKE '%detection%' OR user_question LIKE '%fraud%' THEN 

â€¯ â€¯ â€¯ â€¯ IF EXISTS (SELECT 1 FROM SYSTABLE WHERE table_name = 'expense' AND table_type = 'BASE') THEN 

â€¯ â€¯ â€¯ â€¯ â€¯ â€¯ SELECT 'All Expense Records: ' +â€¯ 

â€¯ â€¯ â€¯ â€¯ â€¯ â€¯ â€¯ â€¯ â€¯ â€¯LIST('ID:' + CAST(ISNULL(expense_id, 0) AS VARCHAR) +â€¯ 

â€¯ â€¯ â€¯ â€¯ â€¯ â€¯ â€¯ â€¯ â€¯ â€¯ â€¯ â€¯ '|Desc:' + ISNULL(expense_description, 'N/A') +â€¯ 

â€¯ â€¯ â€¯ â€¯ â€¯ â€¯ â€¯ â€¯ â€¯ â€¯ â€¯ â€¯ '|Amount:' + CAST(ISNULL(amount, 0) AS VARCHAR) +â€¯ 

â€¯ â€¯ â€¯ â€¯ â€¯ â€¯ â€¯ â€¯ â€¯ â€¯ â€¯ â€¯ '|Date:' + CAST(ISNULL(expense_date, TODAY()) AS VARCHAR) +â€¯ 

â€¯ â€¯ â€¯ â€¯ â€¯ â€¯ â€¯ â€¯ â€¯ â€¯ â€¯ â€¯ '|Category:' + ISNULL(category, 'N/A'),â€¯ 

â€¯ â€¯ â€¯ â€¯ â€¯ â€¯ â€¯ â€¯ â€¯ â€¯ â€¯ â€¯ ' || ') 

â€¯ â€¯ â€¯ â€¯ â€¯ â€¯ INTO @expense_data 

â€¯ â€¯ â€¯ â€¯ â€¯ â€¯ FROM ( 

â€¯ â€¯ â€¯ â€¯ â€¯ â€¯ â€¯ â€¯ SELECT expense_id, expense_description, amount, expense_date, category 

â€¯ â€¯ â€¯ â€¯ â€¯ â€¯ â€¯ â€¯ FROM expense 

â€¯ â€¯ â€¯ â€¯ â€¯ â€¯ â€¯ â€¯ ORDER BY expense_date DESC 

â€¯ â€¯ â€¯ â€¯ â€¯ â€¯ ) AS recent_expenses; 

â€¯ â€¯ â€¯ â€¯ ELSE 

â€¯ â€¯ â€¯ â€¯ â€¯ â€¯ SET @expense_data = 'Expense table not found in database'; 

â€¯ â€¯ â€¯ â€¯ END IF; 

â€¯ â€¯ END IF; 

â€¯ â€¯ 

â€¯ â€¯ -- Clean the user question for JSON (escape quotes and newlines) 

â€¯ â€¯ SET @clean_question = REPLACE(REPLACE(REPLACE(REPLACE( 

â€¯ â€¯ â€¯ â€¯ user_question + ' [Database Context: ' + @expense_data + ']', 

â€¯ â€¯ â€¯ â€¯ '"', '\\"'), CHAR(10), '\\n'), CHAR(13), '\\r'), CHAR(9), '\\t'); 

â€¯ â€¯â€¯ 

â€¯ â€¯ -- Build complete JSON payload directly 

â€¯ â€¯ SET _payload = '{"messages":[{"role":"user","content":"' + @clean_question + '"}]}'; 

â€¯ â€¯â€¯ 

â€¯ â€¯ SELECT c2 INTO _response 

â€¯ â€¯ FROM (AIPOST(@json_payload)) 

â€¯ â€¯ WHERE c1 LIKE '%Body%'; 

   

   -- Parse the JSON and extract the content 

   CALL sp_parse_json('ai_parsed', _response); 

 

   -- Display the response 
   SELECT ai_parsed.choices[[1]].[message].[content]; 

END; 

 

call ask_ai_fraud_detection('Can you detect any fraud in the expenses table, apply Benford law if needed');

Once the response is parsed from its JSON format, we obtain the analysis from the LLM service. Initially, it explains Benfordâ€™s law, and then identifies the dataset as suspicious, and offers recommendations. 

Here is another example of leveraging AI to redact sensitive personal data and generate an alternative treatment plan for patients. Similar to the previous example, this stored procedure retrieves data from the patient_records table and sends it to the LLM service. 

CREATE OR REPLACE PROCEDURE ask_ai_redact( 

â€¯ â€¯ IN user_question LONG VARCHAR 

) 

BEGIN 

â€¯ â€¯ DECLARE _payload LONG VARCHAR; 

â€¯ â€¯ DECLARE _data LONG VARCHAR DEFAULT ''; 

â€¯ â€¯ DECLARE _response LONG VARCHAR; 

â€¯ â€¯ DECLARE @clean_question LONG VARCHAR; 

â€¯ â€¯â€¯ 

â€¯ â€¯ -- Get medical data from the specified table 

â€¯ â€¯ IF EXISTS (SELECT 1 FROM SYSTABLE WHERE table_name = 'patient_records' AND table_type = 'BASE') THEN 

â€¯ â€¯ â€¯ â€¯ -- Build medical data string with all patient information 

â€¯ â€¯ â€¯ â€¯SELECT 'Medical Records Data: ' +â€¯ 

â€¯ â€¯ â€¯ â€¯LIST('Record_' + CAST(record_id AS VARCHAR) +â€¯ 

â€¯ â€¯ â€¯ â€¯ â€¯ â€¯ '|Name:' + ISNULL(patient_name, 'Unknown') +â€¯ 

â€¯ â€¯ â€¯ â€¯ â€¯ â€¯ '|DOB:' + ISNULL(CAST(birth_date AS VARCHAR), 'Unknown') +â€¯ 

â€¯ â€¯ â€¯ â€¯ â€¯ â€¯ '|Gender:' + ISNULL(gender, 'Unknown') +â€¯ 

â€¯ â€¯ â€¯ â€¯ â€¯ â€¯ '|Phone:' + ISNULL(phone_number, 'Unknown') +â€¯ 

â€¯ â€¯ â€¯ â€¯ â€¯ â€¯ '|Email:' + ISNULL(email_address, 'Unknown') +â€¯ 

â€¯ â€¯ â€¯ â€¯ â€¯ â€¯ '|Address:' + ISNULL(street_address, '') + ', ' + ISNULL(city_name, '') + ', ' + ISNULL(province_code, '') + ' ' + ISNULL(postal_code, '') + 

â€¯ â€¯ â€¯ â€¯ â€¯ â€¯ '|SIN:' + ISNULL(sin, 'Unknown') +â€¯ 

â€¯ â€¯ â€¯ â€¯ â€¯ â€¯ '|OHIP:' + ISNULL(ohip_number, 'Unknown') +â€¯ 

â€¯ â€¯ â€¯ â€¯ â€¯ â€¯ '|Diagnosis:' + ISNULL(CAST(diagnosis_description AS VARCHAR(100)), 'Unknown') + 

â€¯ â€¯ â€¯ â€¯ â€¯ â€¯ '|Treatment:' + ISNULL(CAST(treatment_notes AS VARCHAR(100)), 'Unknown') +â€¯ 

â€¯ â€¯ â€¯ â€¯ â€¯ â€¯ '|Doctor:' + ISNULL(doctor_name, 'Unknown') +â€¯ 

â€¯ â€¯ â€¯ â€¯ â€¯ â€¯ '|VisitDate:' + ISNULL(CAST(visit_date AS VARCHAR), 'Unknown') + 

â€¯ â€¯ â€¯ â€¯ â€¯ â€¯ ' || ') 

â€¯ â€¯ â€¯ â€¯ INTO _data 

â€¯ â€¯ â€¯ â€¯ FROM ( 

â€¯ â€¯ â€¯ â€¯ â€¯ â€¯ SELECT * FROM patient_records ORDER BY record_id 

â€¯ â€¯ â€¯ â€¯ ) AS sample_records; 

â€¯ â€¯ ELSE 

â€¯ â€¯ â€¯ â€¯ SET _data = 'No medical records table found'; 

â€¯ â€¯ END IF; 

â€¯ â€¯â€¯ 

â€¯ â€¯ -- Clean the user question for JSON (escape quotes and newlines) 

â€¯ â€¯ SET @clean_question = REPLACE(REPLACE(REPLACE(REPLACE( 

â€¯ â€¯ â€¯ â€¯ user_question + ' [Database Context: ' + _data + ']', 

â€¯ â€¯ â€¯ â€¯ '"', '\\"'), CHAR(10), '\\n'), CHAR(13), '\\r'), CHAR(9), '\\t'); 

â€¯ â€¯â€¯ 

â€¯ â€¯ -- Build complete JSON payload directly 

â€¯ â€¯ SET _payload = '{"messages":[{"role":"user","content":"' + @clean_question + '"}]}'; 

â€¯ â€¯â€¯ 

â€¯ â€¯ SELECT c2 INTO _response 

â€¯ â€¯ FROM (AIPOST(@json_payload)) 

â€¯ â€¯ WHERE c1 LIKE '%Body%'; 

â€¯ â€¯  

    -- Parse the JSON and extract the content  

   CALL sp_parse_json('ai_parsed', _response); 

 

   -- Display the response 
   SELECT ai_parsed.choices[[1]].[message].[content]; 
 

END; 

 

call ask_ai_redact('Replace sensitive personal data with placeholder values like [REDACTED_NAME]. Return the redacted data in the same format. Also provide an alternative treatment plan for each patient.');

The response confirms that all sensitive data has been redacted, and a recommended treatment plan is provided. 

Additionally, we can develop auxiliary stored procedures to simulate context windows, preserving chat history like chat-based AI models like ChatGPT. We can also create procedures that leverage LLMs for data usage predictions, schema analysis, and more. This feature allows us to fully capitalize on the immense potential of both the database and the LLMs. We hope you find this feature valuable and enjoy the numerous opportunities it brings for enhanced database management and analytics!

entry.title: Building Bridges Between SAP and Databricks: A Dream Team for Your Data and AI-Powered Analytics
entry.content:
The Interplay of SAP & Databricks: Why Now?

The combination of SAP and Databricks is more than just a technical integration; it is a strategic course-setting. It brings together the best of two worlds:

  • SAP as a Stable Foundation: Your SAP systems contain the most important business dataâ€”from financial key figures to master data. This data is not only comprehensive but also semantic and contextual, making it an ideal basis for training AI models.
  • Databricks as an Innovation Engine: Databricks offers a scalable platform for Data, Analytics, and AI. It is a powerful engine for machine learning and complex analyses, enabling companies to gain valuable insights from large amounts of data.

This Dream Team transforms corporate management. Instead of merely answering questions like "What happened?", Business AI enables a look into the future: "Why did it happen?" and, most importantly, "What will happen and what should we do?".

Figure 1: Interplay of SAP & Databricks

 

The Benefits of Integration at a Glance

The partnership between SAP and Databricks offers tangible benefits that are evident at the strategic, technical, and operational levels.

Strategic Advantages

The integration ensures open data management and analytics for SAP and non-SAP data. Complete alignment with the SAP Business Data Cloud with strong governance creates a future-proof architecture. The simplified pricing model in general Capacity Units also makes the start easier to plan.

Technical Advantages

The platform is designed to allow extended use via interfaces and can scale with growing demands and data volumes. The seamless integration of the SAP Business Warehouse and SAP S/4HANA with data products enables an end-to-end process. An important difference when deciding for or against an SAP Databricks: The SAP Databricks is fully managed by SAP. This means it is technically operational immediately.

Operational Advantages

Companies benefit from a Hyperscaler infrastructure, which ensures resilience and a reduction in Total Cost of Ownership (TCO). Technical operation is supported by Managed Services from SAP, which reduces complexity in day-to-day business and allows for the installation of upgrades on demand.

How the Dream Team Works in Practice

Databricks offers a number of key elements to enable integration and analysis:

  • Unity Catalog: The Unity Catalog serves as a central landing zone for governance and data products. Metadata is managed here and the data is stored in Delta Tables, ensuring a consistent view of your information and secure access.

Figure 2: Databricks Unity Catalog: The landing zone for governance and data products.

  • Databricks Workspace: Modeling and development take place in the Databricks Workspace. Users work here with interactive notebooks, which offer an encapsulated programming interface for agile and flexible work. SQL, Python, R, and Scala are supported as languages.

Figure 3: Databricks Workspace: Modeling takes place in Databricks within the Workspace, using "Notebooks" among other tools.

  • Databricks Machine Learning: The integration of MLflow enables the training, versioning, and deployment of models. The clear management of training runs and the linking of datasets significantly simplifies the establishment of professional AI in the company. Important to know: The operation of Machine Learning models should strategically take place in SAP AI Core, although Databricks also supports this functionality depending on the use case.

Figure 4: Databricks Machine Learning. Model training (experiments), model versioning, or the deployment of models on one platform.

Conclusion: From Dataset to Smart Decision

The combination of SAP and Databricks elevates data analysis to a new level. Your financial key figures and master data serve as a reliable source for intelligent analyses. The integration with Databricks makes it possible to automatically recognize patterns and correlations from this data. The platform's flexibility and scalability allow complex AI models to be applied and the resulting cluster information seamlessly fed back into your SAP world to enable users to make well-founded decisions. The deep and exclusive technical integration of both worlds guarantees a secure and fast exchange of data products.

Key Takeaways for Your Company

  • Data and AI are moving closer together: The separation between data storage (SAP) and data analysis (Databricks) is a thing of the past. The seamless integration allows your most valuable business data to be used directly for modern AI applications. This creates a unified information base and eliminates fragmented data silos.
  • High Potential through Synergies: The combination of SAPâ€™s standardized data storage and proven processes with Databricksâ€™ innovative AI technology opens up completely new possibilities. You can not only see what happened but also why it happened and what will happen next. This empowers you to act proactively and identify risks early on.
  • Professional AI Establishment: The Databricks platform offers a mature environment for professionally establishing AI applications in the company. Thanks to functions like Unity Catalog for data governance and Databricks Machine Learning for model training, you can ensure that your AI initiatives are scalable, secure, and sustainable.

How You Can Get Started Now: Our Practical Advice

Many companies hesitate to take the first step because the topic seems complex. However, getting started doesn't have to be overwhelming. We recommend starting with a Proof-of-Concept (PoC).

  • Define a Clear Use Case: Choose an area in your company where data analysis can bring real added value. This could be optimizing inventory management, predicting customer behavior, or automating financial forecasts.
  • Utilize Your Existing Potential: A PoC helps you assess how you can tap into your unused data potential. This provides concrete results and allows you to prove the business case for a broader implementation.
  • Start Small to Grow Big: Begin with a manageable project to achieve quick successes and build confidence in the new technology. The scalability of the platform allows you to easily add more use cases later.

The partnership between SAP and Databricks is not a futuristic concept but a practice-oriented solution that helps you make data-driven decisions and future-proof your company. The time to awaken your SAP data from its slumber is now.

Now itâ€™s your turn: What experiences have you already had with using SAP data for intelligent analyses? What challenges do you see on the path to Business AI? We look forward to your perspectives and to shaping the future of data analysis together.
